verses.verse: A Confession of Israel’s Sins (1 Chr 16.34; Ps 105.1) Praise the LORD! O give thanks to the LORD, for he is good, for his steadfast love endures forever.
(Ps 145.4, 12) Who can utter the mighty doings of the LORD or declare all his praise?
(Ps 15.2) Happy are those who observe justice, who do righteousness at all times.
(Ps 119.132) Remember us, (Heb mss Gk: MT me) O LORD, when you show favor to your people; help us (Heb mss Gk: MT me) when you deliver them,
(Ps 1.3; 118.15) that we may see the prosperity of your chosen ones, that we may rejoice in the gladness of your nation, that we may glory in your heritage.
(Dan 9.5) Both we and our ancestors have sinned; we have committed iniquity, have done wickedly.

(Ex 14.11) Our ancestors, when they were in Egypt, did not consider your wonderful works; they did not remember the abundance of your steadfast love but rebelled against the Most High (Cn: Heb rebelled at the sea) at the Red Sea. (Or Sea of Reeds)
(Ex 9.16) Yet he saved them for his name’s sake, so that he might make known his mighty power.
(Ex 14.21; Isa 63.11-14) He rebuked the Red Sea, (Or Sea of Reeds) and it became dry; he led them through the deep as through a desert.
(Ex 14.30) So he saved them from the hand of the foe and delivered them from the hand of the enemy.
(Ex 14.28; 15.5) The waters covered their adversaries; not one of them was left.
(Ex 14.31) Then they believed his words; they sang his praise.
(Ex 15.24) But they soon forgot his works; they did not wait for his counsel.
(1 Cor 10.6, 9) But they had a wanton craving in the wilderness and put God to the test in the desert;
(Num 11.31) he gave them what they asked but sent a wasting disease among them.
(Num 16.1-3) They were jealous of Moses in the camp and of Aaron, the holy one of the LORD.
(Deut 11.6) The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan and covered the faction of Abiram.
(Num 16.35) Fire also broke out in their company; the flame burned up the wicked.
(Ex 32.4) They made a calf at Horeb and worshiped a cast image.
(Jer 2.11; Rom 1.23) They exchanged the glory of God (Compare Gk mss: Heb exchanged their glory) for the image of an ox that eats grass.
(Deut 10.21) They forgot God, their Savior, who had done great things in Egypt,
(Ps 105.27) wondrous works in the land of Ham, and awesome deeds by the Red Sea. (Or Sea of Reeds)
(Ex 32.10) Therefore he said he would destroy them— had not Moses, his chosen one, stood in the breach before him, to turn away his wrath from destroying them.
(Heb 3.18, 19) Then they despised the pleasant land, having no faith in his promise.
(Num 14.2) They grumbled in their tents and did not obey the voice of the LORD.
(Num 14.28-35; Heb 3.11) Therefore he raised his hand and swore to them that he would make them fall in the wilderness
(Ps 44.11) and would disperse (Syr: Heb cause to fall) their descendants among the nations, scattering them over the lands.
(Num 25.2, 3) Then they attached themselves to the Baal of Peor and ate sacrifices offered to the dead;
they provoked the LORD to anger with their deeds, and a plague broke out among them.
(Num 25.7) Then Phinehas stood up and interceded, and the plague was stopped.
(Num 25.11-13) And that has been reckoned to him as righteousness from generation to generation forever.
(Num 20.3, 13) They angered the LORD (Heb him) at the waters of Meribah, and it went ill with Moses on their account,
(Num 20.10) for they made his spirit bitter, and he spoke words that were rash.
(Deut 7.2, 16) They did not destroy the peoples, as the LORD had commanded them,
(Judg 3.5, 6) but they mingled with the nations and learned to do as they did.
(Judg 2.12) They served their idols, which became a snare to them.
(2 Kings 7.17) They sacrificed their sons and their daughters to the demons;
(Num 35.33) they poured out innocent blood, the blood of their sons and daughters, whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan, and the land was polluted with blood.
(Num 15.39) Thus they became unclean by their acts and prostituted themselves in their doings.
(Ps 78.59) Then the anger of the LORD was kindled against his people, and he abhorred his heritage;
(Judg 2.14; Neh 9.27) he gave them into the hand of the nations, so that those who hated them ruled over them.
Their enemies oppressed them, and they were brought into subjection under their power.
(Judg 2.16-18) Many times he delivered them, but they were rebellious in their purposes and were brought low through their iniquity.
(Judg 3.9) Nevertheless, he regarded their distress when he heard their cry.
(Judg 2.18; Ps 105.8) For their sake he remembered his covenant and showed compassion according to the abundance of his steadfast love.
(Ezra 9.9; Jer 42.12) He caused them to be pitied by all who held them captive.
(1 Chr 16.35, 36; Ps 147.2) Save us, O LORD our God, and gather us from among the nations, that we may give thanks to your holy name and glory in your praise.
(Ps 41.13) Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting. And let all the people say, “Amen.” Praise the LORD!
